{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3726794,"name":"Amit sucher","username":"AmitSucher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amitsucher/{size}/257401_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-31T00:02:07.331Z","cooked":"

Hi, we are thinking of making a big sponsors plates (like OP usually makes)

We prefer them being blue, but not sure perspex would be a good fit (with coral hitting it or what else)

Is there any material that we could get in blue that can hold hits more than perspex, be able to put stickers on it and is easily obtainable (and cheap )

image573×417 81.1 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-05T21:54:48.758Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":442,"readers_count":441,"score":243.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Amit sucher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55442,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amit 6738"},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/1","custom_user_title":"Amit 6738","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3726796,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-31T00:15:13.055Z","cooked":"

The usual go-to for durable plastic that can survive hits is polycarbonate (brand name Lexan). It’s not too expensive to get here, you can find it at Home Depot and the like, and looking on the internet it seems possible to obtain in blue, though I wouldn’t be sure about the availability in Israel.

You can paint the inside of the Lexan (polycarb) and it looks great. Tinted material is expensive.

If you have access to powder coating you could do a thin sheet of aluminium.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-08-31T00:22:17.542Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":396,"readers_count":395,"score":99.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Zakk Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering"},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/4","custom_user_title":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3726801,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-31T00:35:15.461Z","cooked":"

6mm acrylic is likely to take many hits from coral just fine.

We hastily rebuilt our funnel between comps with 1/8” acrylic (3mm) and though it cracked from a full-speed robot-to-robot hit, it lasted the event well enough. That was an exposed and cantilevered piece; a protected sponsor panel would have an easier life for sure.

I’d probably make one plus a spare in acrylic and call it good if you like how the blue looks. (Even for main season, but especially for a lower-stakes/learning off-season.)

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-08-31T00:35:15.461Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":377,"readers_count":376,"score":145.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":73488,"username":"Zakk_J","name":"Zakk Jackson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/5","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3726837,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-31T01:38:48.408Z","cooked":"

Corrugated plastic ain’t bad for this. It can take a light beating, comes in blue, and looks decent.

First step is to secure sponsors

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-08-31T02:25:54.563Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":321,"readers_count":320,"score":219.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"rapid react's #1 fan"},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/7","custom_user_title":"rapid react's #1 fan","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3727103,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-31T16:40:46.458Z","cooked":"

We use a sheet of clear polycarb and have a local printshop print on the backside of it. We do B&W as it’s less expensive but I would think most any shop should have your choice of colors.

[edit: add photo]

Aluminum composite panels, like DiBond, can be found in a range of colors and are durable and lightweight. They can be cut on a router.

We have used big paper sheets that have been printed on a plotter and then laminated. It has worked well for us and are very light.

Photo on the left is from before we cut them out when weighing the robot mid season, and second is what they looks like after coming back from worlds.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-01T01:47:45.100Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":104.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Elliot S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.flickr.com/photos/ligerbots/54512384267/in/album-72177720326042286","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/10","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3727676,"name":"Nyx","username":"gellnick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gellnick/{size}/172273_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-01T06:24:53.878Z","cooked":"

Polycarb.

Add in a layer of white paint under the blue spray paint to make it opaque and hide any crimes committed while painting.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-01T06:24:53.878Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":186,"readers_count":185,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Nyx","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29971,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Everything and nothing, all at the same time"},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/11","custom_user_title":"Everything and nothing, all at the same time","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3728440,"name":"Wen Pan","username":"Wen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wen/{size}/264371_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-01T19:55:24.688Z","cooked":"

I would say a sheet of thin (1/16’’ would be fine) polycarbonate is good for this. It is light and easy to cut, although it is very durable in practice and can take a huge ammount of hits(it bends well). For colors and decoration you can find somewhere to print a big colored sticker to put on the clear polycarb. you can even cut the polycarb itself to make numbers or letters.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-01T19:55:24.688Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":77.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Wen Pan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75948,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"We stand with Ukraine! "},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/12","custom_user_title":"We stand with Ukraine! ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3729213,"name":"topgun","username":"topgun","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ba9def/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-02T17:24:47.819Z","cooked":"

Have your media team use Inkscape to put together a graphic that can be printed by a print shop on a vinyl sticker. Any flat surface can be used. Size the sticker size to available flat space, put whatever you want on the sticker. Save as a pdf and send to the printer.

Below is an example of a single sticker fastened directly to the climber for 2022 (also another sticker was on the climber on the other side). @EricH mentioned corrugated polycarbonate, which is also an excellent choice for both protecting your robot and offering a flat spot for the any signage. Regular polycarbonate can also be used. Velcro can be used to attach removable signage locations. Vinyl stickers are not that expensive to print and look professional for the life of the robot. They can also be printed in whatever color(s) and images you want.

Your media team should begin looking for ways to make your robot show your sponsors and make your robot standout starting in week 3-4 when the basic structure of the robot is known.

51928795460_f02c65b20a_om1920×1649 208 KB

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-02T17:24:47.819Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":78.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"topgun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730017,"name":"Bill Van Loo (FRC 1076, FTC25906)","username":"billvanloo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billvanloo/{size}/209774_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T14:05:02.518Z","cooked":"

Agreed! We switched to corrugated plastic (Coroplast) this year for our sponsor boards and were really happy with them. They’re super lightweight, and one of our sponsors printed everything (including our team’s color as the background). All we had to do was cut them to size & shape.

We had them print 3 sets of sponsor boards, which lasted us all season (1 set for 2 district comps, 1 set for state, 1 set for champs). We could have used just one set, but it gets a bit scratched up over time, so swapping for a fresh new set kept the robot looking clean.

4S9A06821920×1280 255 KB

4S9A06901920×1280 230 KB

sokoloff:

6mm acrylic is likely to take many hits from coral just fine.

Please do not use Acrylic on robots. I’ve seen FAR too much (sharp!) shrapnel generated from failed acrylic parts over the years. Acrylic does not belong on FRC robots, there are lots of alternate materials you can use that are far safer.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T14:47:41.654Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":204.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730075,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T15:03:21.976Z","cooked":"

I’d love to find a replacement plastic that laser cuts and laser engraves as cleanly (and safely) as acrylic on our 40W Epilog with filtration but no extraction, because we’d switch to it for our sponsor panels and functional parts.

I’m not trying to be snarky here; I genuinely would be happy to switch, but we’re currently using acrylic for practical reasons based on how great and safely it works on the laser. Other plastics are some much higher amount of unsafe (a non-starter for a school), bad-smelling (not great for the classroom), or very fiddly to cut and engrave on the laser.

You have the wrong tool for the job, no need to force it.

110$ at Ryobi and you can do Lexan on a jigsaw. Sure it’s not automated, but it’s certainly more practical than making a spare sponsor panel because the material is too brittle to be a decoration.

I mean, I’ll agree if you need something transparent with a colored tint, there definitely aren’t a lot of options outside of acrylic, and cutting poly on a laser can be problematic too. That said, if you just need a solid color, there should be plenty of safer options for colored plastics, many of which are used in sign making.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-09-03T17:34:29.418Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505795,"topic_slug":"sponsor-plate-material","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sponsor-plate-material/505795/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3730267,"name":"Danny Faryna","username":"Danny_Faryna","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/danny_faryna/{size}/173777_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-03T17:56:06.568Z","cooked":"

Last year we used 0.02” Polycarbonate film and stuck a large printed sticker with our sponsor graphic onto it. We attached the film using some VHB tape and we cut the film with some scissors. We might go down to the 0.015” film next season

cbale2000:

if you just need a solid color

The reason to use clear acrylic is to do raster laser engraving and edge light with addressable LEDs. That gives us something that looks great for sponsors (who doesn’t like seeing their name glowing on a robot?), and seems durable enough where it’s bolted to a frame formed of metal. If we just wanted 2D shapes cut out, there are a lot of other processes that work and work with materials far tougher than acrylic.

Dieter:

certainly more practical than making a spare sponsor panel

More practical than pushing a button a second time and picking up the finished spare panel 15 minutes later? We’re not running the beam at 100% utilization; we can spare the machine time.
